CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: As the key building block selenium - containing heterocyclic intermediate di(2′-selenienyl)-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole ( DSeBT ) 6^12 was prepared by Pd - catalyzed Stille coupling reaction of dibromobenzothiadiazole 4 and monostannylselenophene 5 , which was then dibrominated by N-bromosuccinimide ( NBS ) to yield comonomer M2 ( 2 steps , 52% overall yield ). The target poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) ( PCDSeBT ) was obtained by Suzuki polymerization of M1 and M2 in degassed toluene / water with K 3 PO 4 as an organic base , Pd 2 ( dba ) 3 as a catalyst , and P(o-tol) 3 as the corresponding ligand at 90 °C for 3 days. The crude polymer was purified by reprecipitation and Soxhlet extraction with methanol , acetone , hexane , and chlorobenzene. Details of synthesis of monomers , polymerization , and their characterizations are given in the Experimental Section. After purification , gel - permeation chromatography ( GPC ) analysis against PS standard exhibits a number - averaged molecular mass ( M n ) of 83^000 g / mol with a polydispersity ( PDI ) of 2.51. The polymer is readily soluble in common solvents such as chloroform , toluene , THF , and chlorobenzene. As shown in Figure 1a , the UV - vis absorption spectra of PCDSeBT both in chloroform solution and solid state exhibit two distinct absorption bands , as typically observed for donor (D)-acceptor ( A ) low bandgap materials. The absorption maxima ( λ max ) of the film are located at 403 and 589 nm. The shorter absorption band is due to π-π* transitions of the polymer backbone , 13 while the lower - energy peak is attributed to intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) in the electron - rich and electron - deficient units. 14 It is worth noting that the maxima absorption values of PCDSeBT in the film are slightly broadened without any obvious red - shift when compared to the solution. This verifies that only a small reorganization via π-π stacking between the polymer chains is within view during the film formation because of the interchain aggregates in solution. 15 This observation is in contrast to many conjugated polymers , in which there is a red - shift that occurs in going from the solution to the solid state due to the aggregation of the polymer chains in the solid state , 3,16 even the PCDTBT film is red - shifted by 30 nm vs solution. 5a Besides , the deep blue color of PCDSeBT solution is observed unlike the red color of PCDTBT in solution ( see the digital photograph in Figure 1a ). Notably , although the absorption profile of PCDSeBT is similar to that of the thiophene analogue , PCDTBT , the absorption onset of PCDSeBT is significantly red - shifted by ∼ 70 nm , corresponding to a lower optical bandgap ( E g opt = 1.70 eV ) than PCDTBT ( E g opt = 1.85 eV ).

Let's think step by step.

Sure, let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph. I will mention the entities I find, and you can confirm or correct me.

1. "selenienyl" - This is a chemical entity, a type of functional group found in the monomer used in the synthesis of the polymer.
2. "dibromobenzothiadiazole" - This is another chemical entity, a type of monomer used in the synthesis of the polymer.
3. "monostannylselenophene" - This is another chemical entity, a type of monomer used in the synthesis of the polymer.
4. "N-bromosuccinimide" - This is a chemical entity, a reagent used in the synthesis of the polymer.
5. "Pd-catalyzed Stille coupling reaction" - This is a chemical reaction, a method used in the synthesis of the polymer.
6. "PCDSeBT" - This is a material name, the name of the polymer being studied in the paragraph.
7. "M1" and "M2" - These are material names, the names of the two monomers used in the synthesis of the polymer.
8. "K3PO4" - This is a chemical entity, a catalyst used in the synthesis of the polymer.
9. "Pd2(dba)3" - This is a chemical entity, a catalyst used in the synthesis of the polymer.
10. "P(o-tol)3" - This is a chemical entity, a ligand used in the synthesis of the polymer.
11. "chloroform" - This is a solvent, a common solvent used in the synthesis and characterization of the polymer.
12. "toluene" - This is a solvent, another common solvent used in the synthesis and characterization of the polymer.
13. "THF" - This is a solvent, a polar solvent used in the synthesis and characterization of the polymer.
14. "chlorobenzene" - This is a solvent, a polar solvent used in the purification and characterization of the polymer.

Please let me know if any of these entities are incorrect or if you would like me to continue identifying more entities in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to "Material Name":

1. "PCDSeBT" - This is the material name being referred to in the paragraph.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDSeBT |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: As the key building block selenium - containing heterocyclic intermediate di(2′-selenienyl)-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole ( DSeBT ) 6^12 was prepared by Pd - catalyzed Stille coupling reaction of dibromobenzothiadiazole 4 and monostannylselenophene 5 , which was then dibrominated by N-bromosuccinimide ( NBS ) to yield comonomer M2 ( 2 steps , 52% overall yield ). The target poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) ( PCDSeBT ) was obtained by Suzuki polymerization of M1 and M2 in degassed toluene / water with K 3 PO 4 as an organic base , Pd 2 ( dba ) 3 as a catalyst , and P(o-tol) 3 as the corresponding ligand at 90 °C for 3 days. The crude polymer was purified by reprecipitation and Soxhlet extraction with methanol , acetone , hexane , and chlorobenzene. Details of synthesis of monomers , polymerization , and their characterizations are given in the Experimental Section. After purification , gel - permeation chromatography ( GPC ) analysis against PS standard exhibits a number - averaged molecular mass ( M n ) of 83^000 g / mol with a polydispersity ( PDI ) of 2.51. The polymer is readily soluble in common solvents such as chloroform , toluene , THF , and chlorobenzene. As shown in Figure 1a , the UV - vis absorption spectra of PCDSeBT both in chloroform solution and solid state exhibit two distinct absorption bands , as typically observed for donor (D)-acceptor ( A ) low bandgap materials. The absorption maxima ( λ max ) of the film are located at 403 and 589 nm. The shorter absorption band is due to π-π* transitions of the polymer backbone , 13 while the lower - energy peak is attributed to intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) in the electron - rich and electron - deficient units. 14 It is worth noting that the maxima absorption values of PCDSeBT in the film are slightly broadened without any obvious red - shift when compared to the solution. This verifies that only a small reorganization via π-π stacking between the polymer chains is within view during the film formation because of the interchain aggregates in solution. 15 This observation is in contrast to many conjugated polymers , in which there is a red - shift that occurs in going from the solution to the solid state due to the aggregation of the polymer chains in the solid state , 3,16 even the PCDTBT film is red - shifted by 30 nm vs solution. 5a Besides , the deep blue color of PCDSeBT solution is observed unlike the red color of PCDTBT in solution ( see the digital photograph in Figure 1a ). Notably , although the absorption profile of PCDSeBT is similar to that of the thiophene analogue , PCDTBT , the absorption onset of PCDSeBT is significantly red - shifted by ∼ 70 nm , corresponding to a lower optical bandgap ( E g opt = 1.70 eV ) than PCDTBT ( E g opt = 1.85 eV ).

Let's think step by step.

1. Selenium - containing heterocyclic intermediate:
 * Di(2'-selenienyl)-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole (DSeBT)
2. Monomers:
 * Dibromobenzothiadiazole (4)
 * Monostannylselenophene (5)
 * Comonomer M2 (formed by the reaction of 4 and 5)
3. Polymer:
 * Poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) (PCDSeBT)
4. Solvents:
 * Chloroform
 * Toluene
 * THF
 * Chlorobenzene
5. Characterization techniques:
 * Gel permeation chromatography (GPC)
 * Ultraviolet-vis absorption spectroscopy (UV-vis)
 * Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA)
6. Optical properties:
 * Absorption maxima (λmax) of PCDSeBT in chloroform solution and solid state: 403 and 589 nm
 * Optical bandgap (Eg opt) of PCDSeBT: 1.70 eV
 * Absorption profile of PCDSeBT: similar to that of the thiophene analogue PCDTBT, but with a significantly red-shifted absorption onset (by ∼70 nm) and a lower optical bandgap (1.70 eV vs 1.85 eV)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Sure, here are the relevant entities from the text that refer to property names of materials:

1. Selenium - containing heterocyclic intermediate (DSeBT)
2. Poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) (PCDSeBT)

These are the only two entities in the text that refer to property names of materials.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities from the text that refer to property names of materials, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Selenium - containing heterocyclic intermediate (DSeBT) |
| Poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) (PCDSeBT) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: As the key building block selenium - containing heterocyclic intermediate di(2′-selenienyl)-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole ( DSeBT ) 6^12 was prepared by Pd - catalyzed Stille coupling reaction of dibromobenzothiadiazole 4 and monostannylselenophene 5 , which was then dibrominated by N-bromosuccinimide ( NBS ) to yield comonomer M2 ( 2 steps , 52% overall yield ). Let's think step by step.

Sure, let's go through the values of material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Values of material properties:

a. Selenium (Se): 6 (number of selenium atoms) + 12 (number of selenium atoms in the heterocyclic intermediate) = 18

b. Dibromobenzothiadiazole (4): 4 (number of bromine atoms) + 1 (number of benzothiadiazole ring) = 5

c. Monostannylselenophene (5): 5 (number of stannyl group) + 1 (number of selenophene ring) = 6

d. N-Bromosuccinimide (NBS): not mentioned

e. Toluene: not mentioned

f. Water: not mentioned

g. K3PO4: not mentioned

h. Pd2(dba)3: not mentioned

i. P(o-tol)3: not mentioned

j. M1: not mentioned

k. M2: not mentioned

l. PCDSeBT: 83^000 g/mol (number-averaged molecular mass) + 2.51 (polydispersity) = 85.51 g/mol

m. PS standard: not mentioned

n. Chloroform: not mentioned

o. Toluene: not mentioned

p. THF: not mentioned

q. Chlorobenzene: not mentioned

r. λmax (absorption maxima): 403 nm and 589 nm

s. Eg opt (optical bandgap): 1.70 eV (for PCDSeBT) and 1.85 eV (for PCDTBT)

Note: The values are approximate and based on the information provided in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to the value of material properties in the provided paragraph:

1. 83^000 g/mol (number-averaged molecular mass)
2. 2.51 (polydispersity)
3. 1.70 eV (optical bandgap)
4. 1.85 eV (optical bandgap)

These are the only entities in the paragraph that directly refer to the value of material properties. The other entities mentioned in the paragraph, such as "dibromobenzothiadiazole", "monostannylselenophene", "N-bromosuccinimide", "toluene", "water", "K3PO4", "Pd2(dba)3", and "P(o-tol)3", do not have a direct relationship to the value of material properties.
